item.title: security: Security strategies for safeguarding governmental data
item.description:
A concise overview of strategies and leadership guidance for government agencies to protect sensitive data and improve overall cybersecurity resilience, as highlighted on the Microsoft Security Blog.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Application volume group for Oracle create data protection volume group (API)
item.description:
Azure has made generally available an enhancement to the Application Volume Group for Oracle API that lets you create data protection volumes inside a volume group preserving the same anti-affinity layout as production volume groups, enabling protection copies that mirror production placement and isolation.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: security: How Microsoft builds privacy and security to work hand-in-hand
item.description:
The article describes how Microsoft aligns privacy and security initiatives, using advanced tools and adherence to global compliance standards to protect customer data and foster trust.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: github: GitHub Spark: Improvements, DPA coverage, & dedicated SKU
item.description:
GitHub announced a set of improvements for Spark, introduced a dedicated Spark SKU, and confirmed that Spark is covered by the GitHub Data Processing Agreement (DPA).

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Confidential computing in Azure Container Apps
item.description:
Azure Container Apps now supports confidential computing in public preview, bringing hardware-based Trusted Execution Environments (TEEs) to containerized workloads to protect data in use and complement existing encryption of data at rest and in transit.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Dynamic data masking with Azure Cosmos DB
item.description:
Azure Cosmos DB is in Public Preview for Dynamic Data Masking (DDM), a server-side, policy-based feature that dynamically masks sensitive data for non-privileged users to help prevent unauthorized access.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: security: The 5 generative AI security threats you need to know about detailed in new e-book
item.description:
Microsoft’s blog post summarizes a new e-book that outlines the main challenges organizations face with generative AI, details the top generative AI security threats, and recommends steps companies can take to strengthen their security posture against unpredictable AI risks.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: security: The importance of hardening customer support tools against cyberattacks
item.description:
Microsoft Security Blog warns that customer support tools, now more connected and data-rich, are increasingly targeted by cyberattacks. Hardening these systems is essential to safeguard customer trust, protect sensitive data, and maintain business continuity.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Introducing Vaulted Backup for Azure Data Lake Storage
item.description:
Microsoft announced the Public Preview of Vaulted Backup for Azure Data Lake Storage (ADLS). Azure Backup now supports vaulted protection for ADLS, providing secure off‑site backups to help ensure business continuity and compliance and to protect data from accidental deletion.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: security: Disrupting threats targeting Microsoft Teams
item.description:
Microsoft highlights that threat actors are abusing Microsoft Teams features across the attack chain and urges defenders to proactively monitor, detect, and respond. The blog recommends layered countermeasures and optimal controls across identity, endpoints, data and app protection, and network controls to better protect enterprise Teams users.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: security: Microsoft Purview delivered 30% reduction in data breach likelihood
item.description:
A Forrester Consulting Total Economic Impact study, commissioned by Microsoft, found that unifying data security, governance, and compliance on Microsoft Purview reduced the likelihood of data breaches by 30% and delivered measurable benefits for modernizing data protection.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Confidential computing for Azure Database for PostgreSQL flexible server
item.description:
Azure Database for PostgreSQL — Flexible Server now generally available with Confidential Computing support, using hardware-based trusted execution environments (TEEs) to protect data while it is being processed.

  • Source: Azure Updates
